title: Fort Sumter National Monument: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth       The park is kid-friendly. Both Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie have Junior Ranger programs. There are also lots of places for kids to explore and learn about American history.        Flat Ranger designed by 4th grader that participated in the Ticket To Ride program at Fort Sumter NPS  National Park Service Flat Ranger This programs allows children to explore National Parks from home. Use the links below to start you on your journey. 1. Pick a Flat Ranger Flat Ranger Boy or Flat Ranger Girl 2. How to Start your Journey 3. Your Passport to Exploration      Flat Soldier Program   Flat Soldier allows children to explore different times of conflict in our history. These periods encompass the American Revolution, the War of 1812, and the Civil War.  Follow the links below to go exploring with the Flat Soldier of your choice.    American Revolution Flat Soldier   How to start your journey   War of 1812   Flat Soldier   How to start your journey    Civil War   Confederate Flat Soldier   Union Flat Soldier   How to start your journey
